intro: Corymbium laxum subsp. bolusii, commonly known as the Bolus's thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
